title: Prince William & Kate Middleton Arrive At Formal Dinner In An Auto & We Relate
text:
Asia and auto rickshaws are almost synonymous. Who hasn’t been rejected by an auto bhaiyya? But, the auto rickshaw is not a means of transport we associate with the rich and famous. They ride around in their luxury Range Rovers literally looking down their noses--considering how high SUVs are--at us mere mortals.



But, the humble auto rickshaw got the royal seal of approval by none other than Prince William and his wife Kate Middleton. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, who are on a five-day tour of Pakistan, arrived at a dinner hosted for them by the British High Commission in Islamabad in a swanky, pimped up auto rickshaw.

#PrinceWilliam & #KateMiddleton arrived today evening at Pakistan Monument in #Islamabad, in a specially decorated beautiful auto rickshaw. pic.twitter.com/5ltT2a8VsS — Sanjay Jha (@SanjayJha) October 15, 2019

Look at those colours! That auto rickshaw is a literal representation of how colourful and fun South Asian culture can be. It’s bright and shiny with flashy pictures of birds.

The best part is the fact that the auto driver is not your basic bhaiyya. He is fully dressed in a proper suit with his pristine white socks showing. Then, out come Prince William and Kate Middleton dressed to the nines. He is dressed in a bandhgala style black sherwani while his wife is in a shiny, emerald green gown.

We also love the fact that Prince William opened the auto rickshaw door on his own. There was no pomp or splendour there. If they were looking to make an entrance, they definitely did.

Not the first privileged people to make autos their ride

Melba Pria, former Mexican ambassador to India, made headlines when she chose an auto rickshaw to be her personal vehicle while in the country.

Honestly, it just makes more sense to have an auto as a private vehicle. Considering how crowded the streets of cities and towns in India--and Asia in general--are, it’s much faster to zip around in an auto. They’re also small so parking will be less of an issue. The biggest bonus? Considering most auto rickshaws run on CNG, they’re also environmentally friendly!

How many of us have found ourselves hailing an auto when Ubers aren’t available or are overcharging us thanks to surge pricing? We’ve done it when fully dressed for a wedding or for a night out dancing too. We’d strut down the streets in our finery and heels, hail an auto and pray to the Gods that our carefully coiffed hair doesn’t get ruined by the wind.

To be fair to the Duchess of Cambridge, she came out of that auto in Islamabad with not a hair out of place. Autos for the win!
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, Prince William and Kate Middleton, arrive at a dinner hosted by the British High Commission in Islamabad in an auto rickshaw.
